summary:
As a Community Engagement Specialist with a background in psychology, I utilize strategic insight, empathy, and innovative technologies to understand and engage both global ecosystems and the internal stakeholders dedicated to serving them. My experience spans delivering hundreds of presentations, workshops, seminars, and conferences in over 25 countries, with a focus on E-commerce and Psychology.

My professional interests lie in exploring online behavior, usability, e-commerce, online communities, cultural differences, and optimizing processes for human interaction. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies, I aim to bring a human-centered approach to digital interactions, fostering connections, and driving engagement within communities. This unique blend of psychology, commerce, and technology allows me to create impactful strategies that resonate with diverse audiences.

📧 x@gui.do

treasury_media.title: Still A/B testing your buttons? You need to think (much) bigger...
treasury_media.description:
When optimizing, a lot of commerce teams seem stuck experimenting with minor frontend changes like tekst, images or layout.
While still valuable to do this, you could benefit much more from the experimentation mindset when applying this to not just your frontend, but to across all aspects of your business
Guido shows you how using Packaged Business Capabilities can give your commerce team the freedom to do just that.

treasury_media.title: Why Marketplace is Your Next Big Initiative
treasury_media.description: Together with Marnix from SQLI I hosted a session about marketplaces for retail organizations. What are all marketplace variants? What is the difference between selling on a marketplace and becoming a marketplace? What are the latest developments and why do we think you really need to be the first mover in your industry when it comes to marketplaces...

treasury_media.title: Persuasive e commerce workshop - Spryker
treasury_media.description: Presentation and workshop material for the Persuasive e-commerce sessions developed by me over the past 10 years in which you learn about decision biases and how to apply these to your customer journey.

treasury_media.title: CRO.CAFE: Award winning CRO Podcast
treasury_media.description: How CRO specialist grow professionally? They learn all about the latest customer focused digital optimization through the CRO.CAFE Podcast!

treasury_media.title: 5 Ultimate Usability tips for Ecommerce
treasury_media.description: Presented by me at Emerce Conversion 2015, about 5 internal/process tips and 5 external/ on-site tips for applying usability improvements to your website or webshop.

awards.title: Winner of the Experimentation Culture Award 2020 - Individual category
Magento Master 2019
awards.description: For my work in the Magento community I was recognized by Magento as a Magento Master in the Mentor category. I was selected based on my 2018 contributions organizing Meet Magento Netherlands, Distributed Magento Contribution Day in Rotterdam and Magento User Group Utrecht as well as well as co-hosting the Dutchento Podcast and helping to shape the Magento Association by serving on the Magento Association Task Force.

awards.title: Community Manager of the Day
awards.description: On April 22nd, I was appointed "Community Manager of the Day" by the organization behind "My Community Manager" because of my work for the Dutch Magento community.

awards.title: Magento - X.commerce Community Builder Award
awards.description: For my active role in the (Dutch) Magento community, I received the "Magento - X.commerce Community Builder Award" out of the hands of eBay CEO John Donahoe in October 2011 at the Innovate Conference in San Francisco.

awards.title: Person of the Year
awards.description: In 2006, TIME Magazine recognized the millions of people who anonymously contribute user-generated content to wikis (including Wikipedia), YouTube, MySpace, Facebook and the multitudes of other websites featuring user contribution. So congratulations to you too! ;)

awards.title: N.B.J.G. Buitenman Trophee
awards.description: De onderscheiding wordt jaarlijks uitgereikt aan de zwemmer of zwemster die de beste prestatie heeft geleverd tijdens een door de Kring Utrecht georganiseerde wedstrijd. In 2003 kwam deze beste prestatie dus op naam van Guido Jansen, die op de 100m. vrije slag een tijd neerzette van 52.06 seconde, en daarmee van alle zwemmers het dichtste in de buurt kwam van een wereldrecord.

awards.title: Dutch National Champion
awards.description: From 1995 until 2004 participated in many competitions - both National and European. I won several swimming awards (e.g. multiple Dutch Champions at the 50 meter breaststroke).

profile_positions.description:
I evangelize Spryker's product & technology and lead the company's empowerment of its global community. If you think this is a dream job: It is!

I manage our community team and we made it to our mission to provide opportunities for community members to be more successful by making them aware of our solutions, enabling them through great experiences, and fostering a culture of collaboration.

I'm a member of the leadership team of our Customer 4 Life division and report directly to our Chief Customer Officer.
profile_positions.title: Global Business & Technology Evangelist

profile_positions.description:
Weekly podcast where I interviewed people working on conversion optimization from agencies, client-side or tool vendors, with a total of over 200 episodes.

🏆 In September 2020 I received the "Experimentation Culture Award" for my work on the podcast.

Besides English, the podcast spun off into a Dutch, Spanish and German version (hosted by other CRO specialists).
profile_positions.title: Podcast host & producer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Customer Experience / Customer Success of the global direct-to-consumer e-commerce channels for the L'OR and TAssimo brands (16 webshops in total), expansion of the experimentation & validation program and driving the adoption of more data-driven decisions.
profile_positions.title: Global CRO Specialist

profile_positions.description:
I founded the local Dutch community for the Magento e-commerce platform and have organized many events throughout the years, including 11 editions of Meet Magento, a conference with over 500 yearly visitors.

🏆 For my work I received the Community Builder Award from eBay CEO John Donahoe. And lot's of love from the community of course ;).
profile_positions.title: Founder, Magento evangelist, Community builder

profile_positions.description:
I improved Vaimo clients’ digital channels and better matched these with their customer behavior/needs by arranging and executing user research, data analysis and experimentation services as part of Vaimo's continuous growth plans.

I evaluated clients’ digital maturity and capabilities for growth and build several Customer Experience Reports. With my experience and practical insights, I’m able to recommend what, why and how to set the strategy for a fast-track to success. And of course help the clients actually implement the plans and adjust align the way where needed.

Besides that I hosted Vaimo’s international Core of Commerce podcast and regularly represented Vaimo at public workshops and conferences to share my experience.

Some of the clients I worked with:
✭ Lecot
✭ Bahne
✭ Bauhaus
✭ Diptyque
✭ Favorite Gifts
✭ Helly Hansen
✭ Heineken
✭ Canal Digital.
profile_positions.title: Senior Digital Consultant & Customer Experience Optimization Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Presentations and workshops are a great way to share knowledge, get feedback and get introduced to other experts in the field. I’ve been speaking at conferences and business events around the world for quite some years now, talking about psychology, e-commerce, conversion optimization, experimenting with the latest technologies like AI and building/structuring CRO teams. I've also held many in-house workshops at corporations helping them widen employee knowledge or help structure their tems and processes.

Some of my presentation can be found at https://www.gui.do/presentation.
profile_positions.title: Public Speaker and Trainer on Persuasive Ecommerce & Customer Experience
Global CRO Lead

profile_positions.description:
Euroflorist is an online e-commerce company selling gifts worldwide with a strong focus on flowers.

As part of the online management team I created and led the optimization team. I set up its processes from scratch to perform user research, experiments, interpret (qualitative/ quantitative) data and validate the changes we made to (elements in) the customer journey. The main focus was on digital channels, but we were expanding the team to be able to include more elements of the customer journey (branding, offline marketing, customer support, logistics).

In the first half of 2017 my team ran over 50 experiments that had a combined projected impact of €4.1M-7.6M increase in profit on a 12-month basis.

Some of the tools I used: Convert (A/B testing), Effective Experiments, Hotjar, Jira, Google Analytics, Supermetrics, Sentient Ascend, RStudio.

I regularly represented Euroflorist at public workshops and conferences to share my experience.
profile_positions.title: Chief Psychology Officer, CX/UX Team manager

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the product team responsible for improving the KPIs of the Comparison Department with a focus on the Kieskeurig.nl brand.

My work involved gathering qualitative and quantitative feedback from users, behavior analysis, A/B testing and deploying the UI and UX improvements to the live website. Besides the conversion optimization itself, an important part of my job was to implement (improved) CRO processes and guide the teams/company towards a more CRO and data driven/informed way of working.
In this year we performed over 50 experiments and raised overall click-out conversions from 39% to over 47%.

Some of the tools I used: SiteSpect (A/B testing), Qlikview (BI), AT Internet & Google Universal Analytics Premium (Web Analytics), Podio, Gdrive and Supermetrics.

I regularly represented Sanoma at public workshops and conferences to share my experience.
profile_positions.title: Conversion Manager Comparison

profile_positions.description:
Online Dialogue is a knowledge driven network organization with entrepreneurial online experts. It's expertises are data science, strategy, design optimization and organization of the online dialogue.

As a cognitive psychologist, I was mainly involved with behavioral analysis and conversion optimization:

✔ Behavioral analysis
An effective client dialogue is based on the knowledge of the client. With quantitative and qualitative research (webanalysis, usability testing, expert reviews, surveys etc.), we mapped this knowledge and connected this to individual clients (in your CRM/ data warehouse). Based on this information we analyzed and optimized the dialogue with the online customers of our clients.

✔ Conversion optimization
Based on insights from the client dialogue analysis we created and engaged in improvement trajectories. The effectiveness of improvements was always validated in a performance dashboard and through A/B/MvT testing in combination with (behavioral or profile) targeting.

Some of the awesome international clients I worked for are...
✭ eBay / Marktplaats
✭ Emesa
✭ International Card Services (ABN Amro Bank)
✭ De Lage Landen / LeaseLoket (Rabobank)
✭ Conrad
✭ ABN AMRO
✭ T-Mobile
profile_positions.title: Senior Conversion Consultant

volunteer_experiences.description:
In the beginning of 2019 I was selected as a member of the inaugural board of directors for the newly formed Magento Association. Our mission is to advance and empower the global Magento community and commerce ecosystem through open collaboration, education, and thought leadership. 

Besides being part of the Board of Directors, I was also a member of the Diversity & Inclusion and the Content committees.

When joining Spryker in Q3 2021, I resigned from my position on the board.

In 2018, Magento Association (MA) is forming as a user-led community. This global community will be structured as a non-profit organization with governance best ensuring that Magento advocacy reflects users, developers, merchants and industry thought leaders. The volunteer community of leaders, including Magento Corporation, will comprise a Board of Directors, committees, task forces and general membership.

I'm part of the temporary (Q3/4 2018) task force of 7 global community members that has been charged with following the key deliverables:

✓ Form articles of incorporation
✓ Form community bylaws
✓ Draft mission statement
✓ Establish Strategic Plan
✓ Build 2019 budget and operating plan
✓ Serve on election committee

volunteer_experiences.role: Vice President & Magento Evangelist, Western Europe
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Meet Magento Association organized/coordinated the worldwide “Meet Magento” events which started in Europe in 2009. As non-profit organization the Meet Magento Association took care of all Meet Magento Events and supported the Magento community and merchants with the localized Magento editions and Magento user support.

I helped evangelise the brand and the events and supported local organizers in many countries starting up their local Meet Magento event and community. I also traveled to many of these events to help support them and share my knowledge and experience on stage: Argentina, Austria, Belarus, Belgium, Brazil, China, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, UK, Greece, Poland, Ireland, Indonesia, Romania, Spain, Sweden, Switserland, US and Vietnam.

In 2018, the Meet Magento Association was superseded by the Magento Association.
One of the first to test and use this UX tool and listed as a Founding Member.
